title: 50's font
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fontfw_5698.jpg)
As seen on a French aircraft
author: fouga

comments.content: Sorry, don't know this one. BTW, part of the /S, this is very close to some "DIN Rounded". Some I like: [Gravur Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed), [Cornelia](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/novotypo/nt-cornelia), [Korolev](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/korolev), [PDU](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/pdu/regular), [Sign Engraver](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/sign-engraver), [Wilma](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeotones/wilma), [Adhesive Letters](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/adhesive-letters), [Tes](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alien/tes), [tdBastard](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typewerk/td-bastard)
Thanks for the tips. Yeah, that "S" is very specific. Haven't seen it elsewhere.

Looks like it has been designed (actually not drawn at all) joining 2 half circles. The only one I know with such a /S is [Kessel 205](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/talbot/kessel-205). May be you coul try to mix it with [Karben 105](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063512/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/talbot/karben-105)...
